pull.title: [qt] TransactionView: highlight replacement tx after fee bump
pull.body: Consistent with #12421 which highlights the transaction after send. ~I'm not too proud of the `QTimer::singleShot(10` bit; any suggestions on how to properly wait for the transactions table to become aware of the new transaction?~ Although I could have called `focusTransaction()` directly from `TransactionView::bumpFee()` I'm using the same signal as the send screen. This should make it easier to move fee bump / transaction replacement functionality around later.

events.body: Concept ACK. NACK the timed single shot ðŸ˜„

Rebased

@promag @jonasschnelli I replaced the single shot with `qApp->processEvents()`, which also removes the need for any `Qt4` specific code.

<!--5d09a71f8925f3f132321140b44b946d-->The last travis run for this pull request was 60 days ago and is thus outdated. To trigger a fresh travis build, this pull request should be closed and re-opened.

events.body: Rebased and switched the to the QT5 `connect()` syntax.
utACK d795c610d3095eeff1bfe5c1a34877cf0a841823, missed the 0.17 feature freeze though.

comments.body: IMO just avoid the lambda and make it therefore Qt4 compile compatible.
Have you tried `qApp->processEvents();` instead of the single shot dummy timer?
Could use the new connect syntax?
@MarcoFalke not sure what you mean by new connect syntax: http://doc.qt.io/qt-5/signalsandslots.html
@promag I find the first version more readable and less intimidating. I noticed the other version in your PR for a similar signal.
